intro: Columnea lucifer, commonly known as the Flame Violet, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant, tubular flowers that range in color from red to orange. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in its natural habitat. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a glossy texture. Columnea lucifer thrives in bright, indirect light and requires high humidity to flourish.
